column4: Shinobi-> is it really a valid xp iso you have put in cd/dvd rom? if you have the physical xp on cdrom , virtual box can access it too
Shinobi-> you tried what? be specific
Shinobi-> again, Im asking you, is the burnt cd image really a valid iso you can boot from?  try to boot from it directly as if you were about to install it..and see if your system boots from it
Shinobi-> thats the point I am making, your copied iso of xp is invalid..you can not even boot from it directly
Shinobi-> get yourself a valid xp iso,
Shinobi-> you have to make sure its a valid bootable image, getting it from jsut anybody ..you are taking chances
Yonie-> easy.. route add default gateway xx.x..x.x
Shinobi-> k3b only burns, it doesnt tell you its a valid bootable iso
is it route add default gateway and the gateways ip?
its quite complicated the whole story, but for now i want to have 2 internet connections, and my dsl must have the default gateway and i want to route the other connections
i have a 384k line, so my max speed to download is like 40kb/s but im limited to 2 gigs a month
just for comparison, here in california, we pay about 30 dollars a month for 1Mbps down/150kbps up dsl
:( thats so awesome!! here i pay about the same for my connection if i convert from Rands to dollars
so when i connect my adsl, is there no way i can find my default gateway?
here our dsl ip changes everytime we connect
